abstract: David Wittig, the former top executive of Westar Energy, was released from prison on bond Monday pending the appeal of his sentence in a bank fraud case. Mr. Wittig was released from the federal detention center in Leavenworth about 2 p.m. and was greeted by his wife, Beth, and Jeff Morris, one of his attorneys. He had served nearly 13 months in prison.
lead_paragraph: David Wittig, the former top executive of Westar Energy, was released from prison on bond Monday pending the appeal of his sentence in a bank fraud case. Mr. Wittig was released from the federal detention center in Leavenworth about 2 p.m. and was greeted by his wife, Beth, and Jeff Morris, one of his attorneys. He had served nearly 13 months in prison.

headline.main: Ex-Westar Executive Gets a Break From Leavenworth
